meanings.definition: To burn or sear with a hot iron or caustic substance as a means of removing diseased or dead tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor was cauterizing the wound to remove the infected tissue.
meanings.sent2: After the surgery, the nurse cauterized the wound to prevent infection.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally cauterized the steak, giving it a unique charred flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to cauterize his heart, leaving him feeling numb.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burning iron cauterizing the wound was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To burn or sear a wound to stop bleeding or prevent infection.
meanings.sent1: The firefighter was cauterizing the wound to stop the bleeding quickly.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, warriors would cauterize their wounds to prevent infections.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef managed to cauterize his finger while cooking dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like cauterizing any doubts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The smell of cauterizing flesh filled the room, making everyone uneasy.
